paper_abstract: In this paper, a switched Kalmanfilter (KF) is used to predict the status of feature points leaving the field of view (FOV), which is one of the most common constraints in FOV. By using the prediction of status to compensate for the real state of feature points, non-holonomic robots conduct visual servoing tasks efficiently. Results of simulation and experiments verify the effectiveness of the proposed approach.
paper_title: A Switched Extend Kalman-Filter for Visual Servoing Applied in Nonholonomic Robot with the FOV Constraint
